group.title: Production design in Picnic at Hanging Rock

results.title: Alternative Lifestyles
results.brief_description: From bubble-wrap insulation to a Buddhist stupa, experience alternative living in Mt Best. Meet Dr Chalko and his environmentally sustainable house and see how he converted a freezer into a fridge that uses less power per hour than a light bulb uses per day. Michael and Mary moved to Mt Best to find peace and to live in harmony with their surrounds, in the process they built a Stupa and a labyrinth in their backyard and invite anyone who wishes to come and contemplate a moment of their time.

results.title: Meeniyan Junior CFA
results.brief_description: The next generation of fire fighters start young. In an effort to encourage the young people of Meeniyan to become senior CFA members, the Meeniyan Junior CFA creates an atmosphere of fun and friendship while teaching kids the basics of fire fighting.

results.title: Life is What You Make It
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars. Frank Arndt, while a newcomer to the town, feels he has finally found his rightful place in Meeniyan and is heavily involved in community activities such as contract bridge and table tennis.
results.description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. results.title: Loch Ladies
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film showcases the many women who drive business in the small Loch Village. The four women featured are representative of the many others who are involved in running businesses in the main street of Loch. These women are smart, funny, hard working and driven individuals who have turned their passion into profit.

results.title: This is Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the creatures that stir in the hills, forests and hall of Mt Best. The people of Mt Best are a special breed, with their Secret Men’s and Women’s Business and their legend of the Bocce Bird. This is a town that consists of a solitary hall but is a constant, thriving hive of activity. Combined with the breathtaking views, Mt Best is a place of mystery, beauty and laughter.
results.description: Meet the creatures that stir in the hills, forests and hall of Mt Best. results.title: Connecting Towns: A South Gippsland Cluster
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.

Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.

results.title: The World of David Milne
results.creator_credit: Gerald Budner, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively, exciting experience of art, from the words and paintings of David Milne. “Art”, he said, “isn’t a fire in the grass; it’s an explosion.” Milne’s letters read as a commentary, tell how he felt about what he painted, how he tried to catch the essence of his feelings “before the power ran out…like escaping steam”. We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Budner, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: A lively, exciting experience of art, from the words and paintings of David Milne. “Art”, he said, “isn’t a fire in the grass; it’s an explosion.” Milne’s letters read as a commentary, tell how he felt about what he painted, how he tried to catch the essence of his feelings “before the power ran out…like escaping steam”. We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.

We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.

results.title: Artists of Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.
results.description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.

results.title: The World of Andrew Wyeth
results.creator_credit: Al Schwartz, Hal Wallace and A Schwartz-Wallace Production
results.brief_description: An examination of the work of American painter Andrew Wyeth. Over thirty-five paintings are shown. Blending the subjects of the artist’s representational style painting with actual scenes from the Pennsylvania and Maine countryside. The artist’s special vision and technique make the lonely countryside, and gnarled people uniquely his.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Al Schwartz, Hal Wallace and A Schwartz-Wallace Production
